body_html: The problem is not in our vector functions, but in the fact that the random function that gives the error has a constant length loop, and it gets vectorized automatically by GCC. I think that the only solution would be to ship additional binaries compiled without SSE4 at all, so that we don't make PyTorch slower for everyone else.

body: The problem is not in our vector functions, but in the fact that the random function that gives the error has a constant length loop, and it gets vectorized automatically by GCC. I think that the only solution would be to ship additional binaries compiled without SSE4 at all, so that we don't make PyTorch slower for everyone else.
